comments:
I received a stacktrace from a user that got this exception while playing a game meanwile. So I dont really have a reproducable case here, but the exception looks strange:

java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Integer
	at org.eclipse.swt.ole.win32.OleFrame.getMsgProc(OleFrame.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.PeekMessageW(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.PeekMessage(OS.java:2158)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2851)
	at net.sourceforge.rssowl.controller.GUI.runEventLoop(Unknown Source)
	at net.sourceforge.rssowl.controller.GUI.showGui(Unknown Source)
	at net.sourceforge.rssowl.controller.RSSOwlLoader.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at net.sourceforge.rssowl.controller.RSSOwlLoader.main(Unknown Source)

Looking at the source, somehow a non-Integer was added into the Display under the key "OLE_HHOOK".

This is with SWT 3.2 M3.

Ben
